summary:
IJsbrand van Veelen is Director and owner at DE DENKFABRIEK | ideeën & uitvoering, a media and concept company founded in May 2014. [www.denkfabriek.com]

As a director and creative for De Denkfabriek he uses his skills as storyteller, concept developer, media advisor, filmmaker, journalist, writer, lecturer and moderator to the fullest. 
De Denkfabriek provides events, films, texts, concepts, brainstorms and lectures for clients such as AMC, EarthToday, VersPers, ACED, 360 Magazine, Ibis/INHolland, MoveS, Emma Kinderziekenhuis, KPN, Provincie Brabant, De Twee Snoeken and others.

Director of documentaries
From 1991-2013 worked as a director of documentaries about society, culture, history, politics and science for VPRO/Dutch national television. Skilled in reportage and in-depth content, from short clips to long, television slot documentaries. 
As a maker and an overseer/commissioner he has a profound knowledge of the documentary making process; from the initial idea, through research, storytelling and scriptwriting, to voice over writing, editing and post-production.
Several of his documentaries won awards at international filmfestivals. Many of his documentaries were sold to broadcasters worldwide.
Programs (selected): Prima Vista, Noorderlicht, R.A.M., Laat op de Avond, DNW - De Nieuwe Wereld, Tegenlicht, Beagle: In het Kielzog van Darwin, Het Snelle Geld. 

Writer
Has an MA in Art-history and Archeology from the University of Amsterdam.
Works as an art critic, essayist and author since 1986. Is currently editor for 360Magazine; editor for VersPers/Small Stream Media; co-editor-in-Chief JordaanGoudenReael
Wrote for Het Parool, Flash Art and Lápiz. Curated several exhibitions. 
Wrote columns and essays on culture from 2002 - 2015 for Kunstbeeld, Holland’s leading arts monthly.

Guest Lecturer
Currently: Business Innovation InHolland | University of Applied Sciences.
Was guest lecturer at Fontys Hogeschool; Media Valley; KABK Den Haag; St. Joost, Breda
